intro: Trichilia dregei, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its smooth, light-colored bark and compound leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, typically arranged in panicle inflorescences. The tree produces woody fruits that contain flat, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal.
